sections.body: An M or F appearing at the end of a spell's name in the spell lists denotes a spell with a material or focus component, respectively, that is not normally included in a spell component pouch.

In the spell lists and the short descriptions that follow them, the spells are presented in alphabetical order by name except for those belonging to certain spell chains. When a spell's name begins with “lesser,” “greater,” or “mass,” the spell is alphabetized under the second word of the spell name instead.
sections.url: pfsrd://Core Rulebook/Rules/Spells/Spell Lists/Spell Lists/Order of Presentation
sections.name: Order of Presentation

sections.body: The term “Hit Dice” is used synonymously with “character levels” for effects that affect a specific number of Hit Dice of creatures. Creatures with Hit Dice only from their race, not from classes, still have character levels equal to their Hit Dice.
sections.name: Hit Dice

sections.body: A spell's power often depends on caster level, which is defined as the caster's class level for the purpose of casting a particular spell. A creature with no classes has a caster level equal to its Hit Dice unless otherwise specified. The word “level” in the short descriptions that follow always refers to caster level.
sections.name: Caster Level

sections.body: The words “creature” and “character” are used synonymously in the short descriptions.
